title: Pressure - comparing pressure on two cubes

content.question: Two cubes made of the same material, sit at rest on the floor. The density of each cube is <math alttext="rho" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>œÅ</mi></math>. Cube <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> has side length <math alttext="s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>s</mi></math> and Cube <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> has side length <math alttext="2 s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>s</mi></math> as shown in the figure. The gauge pressure exerted by the floor on the bottom surface of cubes <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> is <math alttext="P sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="P sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msub></mstyle></math>, respectively. Which of the following correctly relates <math alttext="P sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="P sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msub></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="P sub B is less than one half P sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msub><mo><</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="P sub B equals one half P sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="P sub B equals 2 P sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>P</mi><mi>A</mi></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="P sub B is greater than 2 P sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msub><mo>></mo><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="P sub B equals 2 P sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>P</mi><mi>A</mi></msub></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
